definition: important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
to fail to grasp the main points

sentences.english: He had troubles with the very elements of writing.
sentences.chinese: 他在掌握写作的基本要领方面困难重重。

sentences.english: So automatically they saw a 50 percent uptake in using the enterprise services.
sentences.chinese: 因此它们自动地领会了在使用企业服务中50%要领。

sentences.english: Begin by doing the easiest moves to feel this out.
sentences.chinese: 可以先从最简单的移动来感觉动作要领。

sentences.english: Catechumen will freely decide if he or she wants to be baptized and become a member of the Catholic Church.
sentences.chinese: 慕道者最终应自由的选择是否要领洗加入天主教会。

sentences.english: You just haven't got it right.
Can you teach the base main point of piano?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我讲讲弹钢琴的基本要领吗？

sentences.english: Being relaxed, calm, natural is the basic requirement and the fundamental rule to practice Qigong.
sentences.chinese: 松静自然是练功的基本要领，也是最基本的法则。

sentences.english: Can you tell me something about the ABC of piano playing?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我讲讲弹钢琴的基本要领吗？

sentences.english: I've read and re-read the book, but it won't go in.
sentences.chinese: 我一读再读这本书，但就是不得其要领。

sentences.english: It was a poor performance, full of inconclusive arguments and other commonplaces.
sentences.chinese: 课本不怎么样，尽是不得要领的论说和一些老生常谈。

sentences.english: Could you tell me the basic essentials of playing the piano?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我讲讲弹钢琴的基本要领吗？

sentences.english: By ploughing deep, the productivity of the soil can be greatly increased.
sentences.chinese: 经过深耕的要领，土地的生产率可以大地面进步。

sentences.english: All his attempts to unlock the car were futile, because he was using the wrong key.
sentences.chinese: 开车门，但都不得要领，因为他用错钥匙。

sentences.english: To grasp the operational methods and essentials of trachea intubatton and vagus nerve separation.
sentences.chinese: 掌握气管插管，迷走神经分离的手术方法及操作要领。

sentences.english: They are reading them to get tips, to be prepared.
sentences.chinese: 他们阅读这类小说是为了得到要领，做好准备。

definition: the key trick/the secret of success
a trick/an ingenious method/know-how/the knack (of doing sth)
to grasp (often fig.)/to control/to seize (initiative, opportunity, destiny)/to master/to know well/to understand sth well and know how to use it/fluency
illustration/diagram/graphical representation/to explain with the aid of a diagram
